instruction: In a bowl, combine yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, lemon juice, and salt. Mix well to form a marinade.
title: Prepare Marinade

transcript_segments.text: Hello Fans, today I will teach you how to make Hyderabadi-style Chicken Dum Biryani. This biryani is extremely tasty to eat, and after today, you’ll be able to make it easily at home because I’m going to show you a very simple method.

First of all, I have taken 1.3 kilograms of chicken here. Wash the chicken thoroughly. After washing, put it into the same vessel in which you’re going to make the biryani. Now we have to marinate the chicken.
After that, add some Kashmiri red chili powder — I’ve added one and a half tablespoons here. This will make the biryani spicy and give it a nice color. Then add a little turmeric powder as well.

Along with this, we’ll add some brown onions, also called birista. If you don’t know how to make brown onions, there’s a video on the channel. You can watch and learn how to make them. Also, add 5–6 green chilies.

Add one tablespoon of garam masala powder or biryani masala powder. Now add some mint leaves — wash them well. Also add some finely chopped fresh coriander. Along with this, add some ginger-garlic paste.

instruction: Add chicken pieces to the marinade along with green chilies, half of the mint and coriander leaves. Mix thoroughly and cover. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight.
title: Marinate Chicken

transcript_segments.text: Mix everything well. Now leave the chicken in this marinade for at least half an hour so that the salt, spice, and flavor seep deep into the chicken. Also, squeeze in a bit of lemon juice.

instruction: Thinly slice the onions. Heat oil in a deep pan over medium heat and fry the onions in batches until golden brown and crispy.
title: Slice and Fry Onions

transcript_segments.text: Mix everything well. Now leave the chicken in this marinade for at least half an hour so that the salt, spice, and flavor seep deep into the chicken. Also, squeeze in a bit of lemon juice.

instruction: Remove fried onions and place on paper towels to absorb excess oil. Set aside half for layering later.
title: Drain Fried Onions

transcript_segments.text: Add two tablespoons of desi ghee and mix it well. After adding ghee or oil, don’t use your hands, because the oil starts sticking to your hands.

instruction: Mix the remaining half of the fried onions into the marinated chicken.
title: Add Onions to Marinade

transcript_segments.text: Let the chicken rest in the marinade for at least 30 minutes. Now I’ve taken basmati long-grain rice here, and I’ve washed them properly so that all the dust and starch are removed.

instruction: Rinse basmati rice thoroughly under cold water until the water runs clear. Soak the rice in water for 30 minutes.
title: Rinse and Soak Rice

transcript_segments.text: You need to soak the rice. Soaking gives the rice good fluffiness and length after cooking. Let it soak. Now in a vessel, I’ve put water for boiling rice. First, add salt to the water.

instruction: Warm the milk slightly and add saffron strands. Let it sit for 10–15 minutes to release color and aroma.
title: Prepare Saffron Milk

transcript_segments.text: You need to soak the rice. Soaking gives the rice good fluffiness and length after cooking. Let it soak. Now in a vessel, I’ve put water for boiling rice. First, add salt to the water.

instruction: In a large pot, bring water to a boil. Add salt and whole spices (cloves, cardamom, bay leaf, cinnamon, star anise, peppercorns).
title: Boil Water with Whole Spices

transcript_segments.text: Then add two small green cardamoms, and 4–5 pieces of cinnamon sticks. Add one tablespoon of shahi jeera (royal cumin). Let these spices boil with the water for at least 5–7 minutes.

instruction: Drain soaked rice and add it to the boiling spiced water. Cook until the rice is 70% done—grains should still be slightly firm. Drain the rice immediately.
title: Parboil the Rice

transcript_segments.text: Once the water is boiling, add the rice. Turn the flame to high so that it comes to a boil quickly. Once you’ve added the rice, stir gently with a ladle so that the rice doesn't stick together in the hot water.

Once the boil comes, reduce the flame to medium and cook for 7 minutes. Also, make sure to add enough salt while boiling the rice; otherwise, the biryani will taste bland. The rice should be well-seasoned.
Let it cook for another minute. I told you to cook the rice for 7 minutes. The first layer of rice should go in after 7 minutes. Pour a little of the hot rice water over the marinated chicken.

instruction: Grease the bottom of a heavy-bottomed pot with a little ghee. Spread the marinated chicken evenly as the bottom layer.
title: Prepare for Layering

transcript_segments.text: Let it cook for another minute. I told you to cook the rice for 7 minutes. The first layer of rice should go in after 7 minutes. Pour a little of the hot rice water over the marinated chicken.

instruction: Spread the parboiled rice evenly over the chicken layer.
title: Layer the Rice

transcript_segments.text: Now gently layer the first batch of partially cooked rice over the chicken. This rice should be slightly undercooked because the moisture in the chicken will help cook it further.
Now add the remaining rice as the third layer and spread it evenly across the top so the bottom layer of rice gets covered properly. The top layer should be nicely spread.

Now pour a little kewra water over the top. You’ll need to work quickly here, because if the rice cools down, it will take time to heat up again. Sprinkle some saffron soaked in water over the top as well.

instruction: Top with the reserved fried onions, remaining mint and coriander leaves, saffron milk, and drizzle with ghee.
title: Add Final Garnishes

transcript_segments.text: Now pour a little kewra water over the top. You’ll need to work quickly here, because if the rice cools down, it will take time to heat up again. Sprinkle some saffron soaked in water over the top as well.

instruction: Cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid or seal the edges with dough to trap steam inside.
title: Seal the Pot

transcript_segments.text: I’m using foil paper to seal the pot for dum (slow steam cooking). You can also seal it with dough and place a lid on top. As you can see, I’ve sealed both sides with foil. Now sprinkle a little water over the top.

instruction: Place the sealed pot on high heat for 5 minutes. Then reduce to very low heat and let cook (dum) for 25–30 minutes.
title: Cook on High and Low Heat

transcript_segments.text: I’m using foil paper to seal the pot for dum (slow steam cooking). You can also seal it with dough and place a lid on top. As you can see, I’ve sealed both sides with foil. Now sprinkle a little water over the top.
Place the lid on top. First, cook it on high flame for 2–3 minutes because the chicken is still cold and will take time to heat up. So give it 3 minutes on high.

instruction: Turn off the heat and let the biryani sit for 10 minutes to settle and absorb flavors.
title: Rest the Biryani

transcript_segments.text: Then reduce the flame to medium-low. As you can see, steam has formed nicely inside the biryani and the foil paper has started to puff up. This is the kind of flame you need. And always use a tawa (griddle) below if possible.

Now remove the foil paper. In 20 minutes, the chicken cooks completely, especially if you’ve used medium-sized pieces — they cook even faster. Now sprinkle a little mace powder on top for an excellent aroma.
And finally, garnish with some finely chopped fresh coriander leaves. This adds great flavor and freshness to the biryani.
Now start serving the rice like this. Whenever you scoop out biryani, do it from the sides. Don’t dig from the center, or the rice will break. This is how you properly serve biryani.

instruction: Gently fluff the rice with a flat spoon without breaking the grains. Serve hot with raita, salad, or mirchi ka salan.
title: Serve

transcript_segments.text: Now start serving the rice like this. Whenever you scoop out biryani, do it from the sides. Don’t dig from the center, or the rice will break. This is how you properly serve biryani.
